Keri Mallari

I am a PhD student at UW HCDE advised by Dr. Gary Hsieh. My research interests are in the field of human-computer interaction and social computing. I received my undergrad degree from CUNY Lehman College with a BS in CS and a BA in Math supported by the Macaulay Honors Program.

I am a 2021 Twitch Research Fellow.
kmallari@uw.edu
CV
LinkedIn
Twitter

Right now, I'm usually thinking about how to support content creators through the lens of online feedback exchange. Below are some of my past and present projects.

Exploring Content Creators' Feedback Seeking Behavior

Understanding what works and what doesn't when content creators (i.e. live streamers) seek feedback from their community. Designing prototypes to facilitate a more seamless feedback process.

Analytics Needs of Video Game Streamers

Conducted an interview study to describe the ecology of analytics tools utilized, define streamers' areas of analytics needs, and identify opportunities to support streamers and their communities.
CHI 2021
